author: Special Correspondent
text:
Gold jewellery weighing around 50 sovereigns have been reportedly stolen from devotees who thronged Mylapore on Sunday and Monday to take part in the panguni uthiram festival.

Police sources said that victims lodged complaints at the police outposts created for the festival.

Around 15 people complained that their gold ornaments were stolen.

The police will check footages obtained from the closed circuit television cameras they had installed at different locations.

Police suspect the crimes to have been committed by chain snatching gangs.
title: Devotees lose gold jewellery
